channel.title: Yongin-si on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Yongin Korean Folk Village - Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
Yongin Korean Folk Village Workshop Street

Yongin Korean Folk Village

Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

Yongin Korean Folk Village (1974) is a historical theme park that reproduces the daily life of the Joseon Dynasty and is famous as a complex cultural tourist spot where you can learn, experience and enjoy Korean traditional culture. Particularly, we participated in the '2015 Open Tourism Contest' project, and have led the improvement of convenience facilities to increase tourism accessibility for the tourist vulnerable (disabled people, the elderly, families with young children, etc.). This is a rare example for a private business, and it is a glimpse of the advanced companies that everyone dreams of happy tourism.
Yongin Korean Folk Village 내용 Improvement of accessibility for the vulnerable
When entering the parking lot, the disabled parking area (40 pages) is located very close to the ticket office for easy access.
Standing signs
In addition, there are several standing signs indicating the location of the parking lot, so it is easy to check even from a distance, and it is possible to check the parking area for the disabled even after the vehicle is parked.
Ground map
Consideration for the visually impaired using public transportation is also noticeable. Braille blocks were installed on the pedestrian path from the bus and taxi stops to the entrance where the ticket counters were located, so that they could arrive at the front door comfortably.
Braille block for the visually impaired installed up to the entrance
In addition, a toilet for tourists with disabilities is installed outside the front door and a braille block is placed in front of it to help the visually impaired.
Disabled toilet (located outside the main entrance)
The ticket counter was made lower than the normal counter to match the eye level of the disabled wheelchair users.
Ticket counters for the disabled
On the right side of the ticket office, there is a general information bulletin to help the blind understand.
Korea Folk Village Comprehensive Guide
Tentacles and Braille
In addition, a ramp was installed at the entrance of the unmanned ticket machine opposite to it, so that families with disabilities in wheelchairs or infants using strollers could access it comfortably.
Unmanned ticketing machine for admission ticket to Korean Folk Village (installed on a slope)
If you cut the ticket and enter the front door, a leaflet for the disabled is available. Courses that facilitate the movement of the elderly or wheelchairs are meticulously displayed, making it easy to understand the arrangement of traffic lines and buildings.
Tourist information leaflet beach
Leaflet for the disabled
An audio guide terminal is available in the duty room on the left side of the front door to help guide tourists with visual impairments.
Audio guide usage guide (duty office)
This is an alternative service according to the commentary's non-resident, and you can listen to detailed descriptions of the Joseon Dynasty buildings and traditional culture experiences in folk villages. (Rental 2000 won)
Audio guide terminal (for rental)
In the Korean Folk Village, 99 farmhouses, Gwan-a, Seowon, Oriental Medicine Room, Seodang, Blacksmithing, and Organic Workshop, including farmhouses and private houses with distinct characteristics of each region in the late Joseon Dynasty, are reproduced in their original form.
Korean Folk Village
Panoramic view of Korean Folk Village
The journey to the village of the Joseon Dynasty begins with a paper with a wish written on it. When you enter the village, the first thing you meet is Hyojamun. It was built in honor of Hyoja Lee Duk-gyu's filial piety, but it was said to have been put on the road where many people deliberately intended to serve as a good example.
Hyoja Moon
Wish
Wish stone tower
Yangbanga, one of the most popular places in the folk village, is said to have moved the building in Suwon Castle in 1861.
Yangbanga courtyard
You can see the typical living space of the upper class who worshiped Confucianism such as Sotdaemun, Joulehaengrang, Outside Love, Anhaengrang, Ansarang, Naedang, and Chodang.
Yangbanga on a ramp
If you go deep through the yard, you can see a thatched house that doesn't go well with the Yangban house. This is a space where the Gyusu of Yangban family learned the simplicity and had a bridal class.
Yangbanga
You can get a glimpse of the ancestors of the ancestors who did not forget the frugal life of ancestors, while having the appearance of an imposing family.
A condominium that is located inside the Yangban-ga
At Yangbanjip courtyard, traditional weddings are reproduced twice a day at 12 and 4 pm every day. At the end of the wedding, you can also see a new parade where the bride rides to the house.
Reproduction of traditional wedding
Traditional Wedding Bride Kiln
Pastoral
Gwan-ah is also a popular place for people to drop by. A ramp is installed next to the entrance to the front door, so visitors with wheelchairs or strollers can comfortably view it.
Gwan-a Dongheon approach ramp with safety handle
Government office
Punishment experience in the courtyard in front of Gwana
In the performance hall in front of Gwan-a, there are exciting play boards such as Nongak and Masang Martial Arts. A part of the grandstand was prepared as a wheelchair-only seat so that tourists with disabilities could sit down with their guardians and enjoy the performance.
Outdoor theater
Stunt
Wheelchair viewing reserved seat installed in outdoor theater
After hanging out, let's go to the marketplace. There are plenty of seats with ramps for wheelchair or stroller access. After sitting in a sunny place and drinking a cup of sweet Dongdongju in a crispy pancake, there is nothing to envy the world.
Folk Village Sanga Village Market
Folk Village Sanga Village Marketplace Restaurant
Folk Village Sanga Village Marketplace Restaurant
There is also a restaurant (Korean pavilion) in Sanga village that can fill your hunger. There are plenty of ramps in the entrance of drinks vending machines as well as restaurants, so it is easy to access.
Sanga Village
Restaurant with ramp (Korea Pavilion)
Drink vending machine with ramp
When you pass the workshop street and head to the Oriental Medicine Room, there is a newly remodeled handicapped toilet (slope, braille block, braille guide plate, wheelchair rotation space, auxiliary handle installation, automatic door installation, etc.).
Improved disabled toilets (male and female) outside
Including this, there are five toilets for the disabled in the Korean Folk Village.
Improved disabled toilet interior
In addition, the Korean Folk Village is a fun place to discover. Vegetables planted among private houses, cockscombs and chapels that bloom in the corner of the yard, gourd vines, duck families who enjoy the weight, and carp swarms of adult forearms.
Children playing with ducks
Jangseung in Folk Village
Park Hyukkul planted in a folk village
If you enjoy even making a mask or dyeing, the day will pass.
Way to Craft Village
Natural dyeing experience private house
Ferry experience
You will be immersed in a simple mood and look around here and there. Finally, you will meet Seonangdang, the patron goddess of the village.
Seonangdang, the patron goddess of the village
You may wish to stand under the tree for a moment and recall the hearts of the old ancestors and wish the well-being of the village.
Korean Folk Village with various events
Travel information

Web page address

-Yongin Korean Folk Village: http://www.koreanfolk.co.kr/about/tour_intro.asp

item.title: Folk Village, Winter Romantics - Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
Korean Folk Village's entrance, generals looking happy

Folk Village, Winter Romantics

Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

I saw a piece of wood erected on a plate of water at a vinyl house flower shop. There is no root, but one green leaf growing on a piece of wood leaves a long aftertaste. Sometimes when your head is heavy and your heart feels dry, imagine putting your mind on a plate of water. Then I draw a picture of a leaf coming out of my mind, but it still works quite well. This time, I tried to raise my mind and body in the 'Korean Folk Village', a village where folklore is high.

On October 3, 1974, the Korean Folk Village was opened. Beyond the door is the space where the lives of the people of the Joseon Dynasty, which became increasingly distant as time passed, were revealed. Although it is not a person's house, it is a house where people lived, but the story of flowers and folklore is engulfed by vivid reproductions of the very rare and invisible old places.

Korean folk villages on winter weekdays are relatively rare in a quiet atmosphere. Probably because it is cold. As she was discovered that she couldn't be hidden by the crowds, the beautiful scenery in every corner continues. Experience programs can be participated without waiting, and there is no need to hurry and hurry because of the waiting person. It's great to be able to sit around and watch the performances. To enjoy this, it is very helpful to wear warm clothes, attach a hot pack that can be glued close to the exposed area, and prepare warm water in a water bottle.

Winter mood in every corner of the folk village

It is difficult to describe 'folklore' by pinching it. It is briefly defined as 'a word that encompasses customs, beliefs, skills, and traditions of life related to civil life', but the depth and wide categories contained in it are not simple. It is best to move your body to find out when you do not seem to know the same thing. The Korean Folk Village is a good alternative. A village of about 1 million square meters decorated with folk-related traditional houses, performances, experience programs, exhibits, and marketplaces. This large space is full of folklore.

Winter mood in every corner of the folk village
Memories reproduced from hands
The theme prepared by the Korean Folk Village this winter is an experience to experience the wise skills and wise life of the ancestors of the 'Winter Dongdong Country House Story'. In addition, you can feel the expert's touch in that area, which is a better opportunity.

He enjoyed a game called kite fights. It is a game of blowing a kite and twisting each other's strings to cut the other's strings or drop the kite. So, I also fed grass with glass powder on the kite line. As I follow the hand that leads the kite making experience, memories of kites come to mind one by one. Shield kite is complete. Hanji is firm, and the flat and curved parts are clean without wrinkles.

Kite making experience

Don't miss the 'twinning the straw' experience. In early winter, farmers gathered and brooded the young. At the end of the harvest, he gathered the remaining rice straw and made a new one to replace the old sandals, yolks, and cords, and prepared for the New Year in advance. Farmer's wisdom is not unreasonable.

"Don't die!" After hitting the top with the line that the arm fell, it felt like I was burning white. Children seem to be playing with a horn on their tops these days. The experience of making a handcraft while showing the traditional shape of the top will be a pleasant memory for both children and adults. In addition, there is also a 'Ondolbang Experience' where you can learn how to make a traditional ritual using Yeopjeon and Hanji, and learn the principles of Ondolbang by burning the fire yourself.

Twine experience
Find personality in traditional housesLearn wisdom in traditional folklore

The reason why the traditional play experience is felt is the traditional house. There are about 270 houses in the folk village, and local and private houses and Yangban houses are located everywhere. Let's learn what the characteristics of each house are and learn the individuality. Each feature will be seen in the room where the yard lived in the Toho house, the entrance to the house of the person in the rice field, the barn of a local farmhouse, and the chimney of a mountainous farmhouse. We recommend that you stop by and take warm memories while visiting.

Southern Gate

The roof rose from a house. "I'll give you a bird," the roof on which my teeth were picked up when I was young. Children living in apartments do not know, and these customs are displayed in the traditional folk museum. Is this folklore only in Korea? At the World Folk Museum, folk heritage is collected and displayed in various countries.

Traditional Folk Museum, Old Maternity Tools

If you are hungry, let's go to the marketplace prepared in the folk village. It is perfect to see performances or events after filling the boat. In the Korean Folk Village, you can see Nongak play, tightrope, and horse riding performances even in winter.

Winter Guest Award
Korean Folk Village Performances Three Musketeers: 'Nongak play, tightrope, horse riding'
It is best to see Nongaknori performance in the field. Impressed by television is less than half the scene. You lift your body and turn your hair and feel the wind pushed by the gesture. In the meantime, the percussion instruments and the shadow of the percussion band are busy. The child who was watching the show jumps in succession.
The National Intangible Cultural Heritage No. 58 'Tightrope' is also a specialty of the Korean Folk Village. In the old days, it was a precious performance that was only seen in crowded places during the holidays. The dexter on the line was called 'Zulkwangdae' and is an old culture that has been passed down since the Three Kingdoms period. In winter, the snow melted on the strings, making them slippery, and I was worried that my hands and feet would freeze in the cold of the river, but I was worried about the delicate balance. Besides, it's fun to talk over the line and spit it out.
Nongak Play
Based on the literature, you can see 'Masang Martial Arts', which has been proved. Performances that lead to laughter and laughter are also seen on horses. In addition, the performances performed by horses and humans, including hiding the body next to the body of the horse, shooting a bow on the horse, and throwing a spear, are amazing and surprising.
funambulism

The child, who was walking around the folk village holding hands of the parents, suddenly becomes an adult and visits the folk village. A child is hanging in his hand. As such, the folk village is a place of remembrance and a place to soothe hometown nostalgia.

Travel information

Restaurants near

-Gijijip: Sundubu Korean Restaurant / 55 Baeknamjun-ro, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-282-2708
-Kama Myeongga: Pot rice set meal, galbi / 638-11 Bajeong-dong, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-265-9231
-Gomsol Maru: Mushroom hotpot / 2181 Yonggu-daero, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-282-2967
-Park Cheomji: Chueotang / 128, Gongse-ro, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-286-3311

Rooms

-Windsor Castle Tourist Hotel: 212, Sinjeong-ro, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-895-5000

-Yongin Natural Recreation Forest: 220, Chobu-ro, Mohyeon-myeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do / 031-336-0040

http://www.yonginforest.net/

-Hanhwa Resort Yongin: 79 Bongmu-ro 153beon-gil, Namsa-myeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

http://www.hanwharesort.co.kr/

item.title: Enjoy adventure by becoming a flying squirrel in the deep forest, Yongin Natural Recreation Forest - Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
Ecore Adventure, flying like a flying squirrel

Enjoy adventure by becoming a flying squirrel in the deep forest, Yongin Natural Recreation Forest

Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

“Yah ~” “Exciting!”

Children's exciting cry echoes through the forest. It is a flying squirrel that can move from tree to tree in an instant. The expression that was scared of the first adventurous adventure suddenly changed to a serious expression. This is an eco-venture designed to help you enjoy the adventure by picking old trees. It is a different adventure to enjoy forest and nature with minimal facilities.

Deep mountain adventure
The Yongin Natural Recreation Forest, Eco-D Venture, tends to be full on the weekends, but it's easy to make a reservation during the week. However, it may be convenient to make a reservation in advance, as it may not be available for group reservations.
Experienced students receiving safety training

Make a reservation with the 10 o'clock experience and go to Eco-D Venture. The morning forest road is absolutely refreshing. It is available six times a day, at 10 am, 11 am, 2 pm, 3 pm, 4 pm, and 5 pm. Each seat has 20 people except 5 pm. Even in the woods, it's hot in the middle of the day, so it's a good idea to make a reservation in the morning or late.

Safety hooks and pulleys must be carefully used
When you arrive at Ecored Venture, check your reservation first, and then wear hard hat, gloves, and safety equipment. Children's gloves are also available, so don't worry. After all safety equipment is worn, safety training is conducted prior to the actual operation. At this time, it tells you how to use the equipment and cautions. When grabbing the pulley used to go on a rope, one hand should hold the pulley and the other hand should hold the string. When the pulley rolls, never bring your hand in front of it, as there is a risk of injury.
How to catch pulleys safely
After completing the training, move to the small practice space located next to you to practice hooking and pulling out the hook and putting on and off the pulley. When a child is young, the grip strength is weak, so it is not easy to use equipment, but if you practice a few times and learn the tips, you can do it yourself.
Monkey Course and Chimpanzee Course
It's finally time for action. For infants, the guardians are watching the first few times, and if you need help, it is a good idea to help right away. If you have multiple visitors, you can hurry up and worry about the back person, so it is good to take time and do it one by one.
Thrilling King Kong course
Courses are divided into monkey, chimpanzee, and king kong courses. The Monkey Course can be challenged for toddlers 5-6 years old, the Chimpanzee Course is for children 7-10 years old, and the King Kong Course is for adults 11 years old and older. The King Kong course is made of taller and more distant trees than the monkey and chimpanzee courses, so it feels quite thrilling. The Monkey Course and Chimpanzee Course do not differ significantly in difficulty, so even toddlers can try the Chimpanzee Course. You can do two courses together or just one, but if you are a king, it is good to try both courses. It is too short for one course, and the children are disappointed because the equipment usage is over.
The feet shake, the more carefully
Muho Descalard climbs up the tree on a ladder, Pathel crosses like a stepping stone by connecting two lines between trees, Filled Ssangju crosses the net, crosses a small house on a tree, and boards from high to low Various adventures await, such as the tyrolien slipping down and the tono passing through a wooden cylinder. The name is strange and difficult, but there is no problem at all without knowing the name of each point. All you have to do is to hang the safety rings one by one and do not hurry and do it slowly.
Landing nicely on a pulley
When I receive safety education, every time a child who is overwhelmed nervously challenges one by one, he gains confidence, feels fun, and brightens his face. It is especially exciting when flying through a tree in a pulley. I feel like I'm Tarzan flying freely through the jungle. After all the courses are over, the children shout “One more time!” With the above-mentioned expression. It takes about an hour to complete safety training and finish the monkey course and chimpanzee course. The duration of the King Kong course is similar. There is no age limit, but you need to be over 110cm tall to challenge.
Passing through the cylinders of the monkey course
Campsite and trails
Many people use Yongin Natural Recreation Forest, but campsites are also popular. Even in the middle of winter, it is difficult to grab a site on the weekend. You can get a feeling of being surrounded by nature by constructing a site naturally by cascading between dense trees and on a mountain slope. It's cumbersome to have your car parked in the parking lot and move your hand luggage, but thanks to it, you can see it separately at night and hear the bugs and camp as naturally as possible.
A campsite surrounded by forest
There are several playgrounds at the entrance to the campsite, all of which are forest playgrounds for children. There are no rides common in apartment complexes. Here, the playground is also “green”. Riding a horse, climbing on a slide of a wooden house, and holding a line on a wooden barrel connected between wooden pillars and crossing it. Even if you play all day, the kids don't seem bored.
Eco-friendly forest playground decorated with wood
Wetland garden for walking
Ecod Venture is located in the innermost part of the recreational forest. On the way, you will naturally pass through the wetlands. The deck is spread over the wetland area, so it is easy to walk lightly. There are also several stairs, but you can also look around with a stroller, mainly made of ramps. The sound of a frog rumbling around a small pond where you can observe lotus flowers, aquatic plants, and insects, and flowers bloom from time to time by collecting wild flowers and native flowers around us. As you climb up the promenade, there are also salamander habitats, as well as signs of “snake vigilance”. Be careful as snakes can actually pass over promenades.
Phytoncide Promenade
The lawn plaza, which is the front yard of the recreational forest, is a place where visitors on the weekend install a mat, tent, and tarp. From last spring, as the weekend visitors were switched to the reservation system, the dense grassy squares were freed up and parking and vehicle congestion problems were eliminated. If you want to enjoy outings on the weekends on the day of the Ecod Ventures and Recreation Forest, you must make a reservation. There is no need to make a separate admission reservation when using the accommodation.
Visitors observing lotus flowers in wetland garden
Yongin Natural Recreation Forest is also a paragliding mecca. Several paragliding specialists are located at the entrance of the recreational forest, and there is an active factory at the top of Jeonggwangsan (563m) that rises behind the recreational forest. On a weekday, a paraglider that seemed rare, flies at once as if it bloomed in the sky on the weekend. The arrival point is just below the recreational forest, so it's interesting to see it landing by turning on the lawn square. There are also two-person experience flights accompanied by experts, so if you are curious, take the courage to challenge.
Paraglider gliding over the grassy square
Travel information

Yongin Natural Recreation Forest
-Address: 220, Chobu-ro, Mohyeon-myeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do
-Inquiries: 031-336-0040

www.yonginforest.net

Restaurants near
-Old Site: Hanwoo Flower Sirloin and Hanwoo Gukbap / 9 Neungwon-ro 132beon-gil, Mohyeon-myeon, Chein-gu, Yongin-si / 031-339-6630
-Cheil Restaurant: Sundaeguk / 11 Baekam-ro 201beon-gil, Baekam-myeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si / 031-332-4608
-Kong Madang: Cheonggukjang / 18, Nampyeong-ro, Yangmyeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si / 031-338-0821

Rooms
-Hotel River: 73, Galcheon-ro 7beon-gil, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si / 031-283-3601 ~ 3

http://www.hotelriver.co.kr/kr/index/
-Q (Q) Hotel: 10-3 Jeondaero 110beon-gil, Pogok-eup, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si / 031-339-8881 ~ 2

http://www.qhotel.co.kr/

-Yangji Pine Resort: 112, Nampyeong-ro, Yangji-myeon, Cheoin-gu, Yongin-si / 031-338-2001

http://www.pineresort.com/
